item.title: Alexa, shame on you
item.description: I don‚Äôt ask much of Alexa. I really don‚Äôt."Alexa, all lights on""Alexa, next song""Alexa, weather"And somehow, it still manages to baffle me with how poorly it performs. Five years ago, I saw this thing as magical. Somehow, it was able to take my voice from across the room, convert it into a command, and do what I wanted it to do most of the time. But times have changed.Today, we have large language models which can write hundreds of lines of working code, understand voice with near-perfect accuracy, and actually generate audio waves instead of just using text-to-speech. 4 years of incredible, mind-blowing advancements ‚Äì and Alexa hasn‚Äôt changed a bit.Here is something that happened this morning:"Alexa, play the previous song again""Here is a song you recently played"I don‚Äôt know how Alexa works under the hood. I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs very complicated and not something that can be upgraded easily, but it‚Äôs down right embarrassing that in this day and age, Alexa can‚Äôt play the previous song about half the time I ask it to. It fails to turn on/off all the lights in my apartment maybe a third of the time. It randomly disconnects from my smart home devices. I‚Äôve completely given up on trying to program a scene into it.I know I‚Äôm complaining a lot, but come on. We deserve better.Please, Amazon, fix Alexa.

item.title: Developing UI Component in Blazor MAUI
item.description:
Join us live as we dive into cross-platform component development using Blazor with .NET MAUI ‚Äî the future of native app development powered by web tech!
In this session, we‚Äôll: Break down how to architect reusable UI components for mobile and desktop Explore native capabilities through MAUI‚Äôs platform APIs in a Blazor context Show how to share logic and design across Android, iOS, Windows, and macOS Live-code real-world components and integrate them into a working app Whether you're a .NET developer, mobile enthusiast, or architect looking to unify your stack, this stream will give you practical insights into building flexible and scalable Blazor MAUI components.
üîß Bring your questions. üîÅ Share your thoughts. Let‚Äôs build the future of cross-platform .NET ‚Äî together.
#Blazor #MAUI #DotNet #CrossPlatform #ARKLive #DevStream
